current_state: Single point of failure in Frontend development.
recommended_action: Dedicate 8 hours per sprint for a backend developer (backend.dev2) to pair program with the frontend developer on low-complexity UI tasks.
expected_benefit: Reduces bottleneck risk by 30% and provides a backup resource for bug fixes or minor UI changes.
success_metrics: Backend developer can independently complete a 3-point UI story by Sprint 4.
roi_calculation: Mitigates risk of project delay valued at over $50,000.

current_state: QA effort is concentrated in a single task (TASK-007), creating a late-cycle quality risk.
recommended_action: Formally allocate 20% of the QA Engineer's capacity (approx. 13 hours per sprint) to continuous testing activities, including test planning, exploratory testing, and automation for features developed in that sprint.
expected_benefit: Earlier defect detection, improved quality, and reduced end-of-project bug fixing effort by an estimated 40 hours.
success_metrics: Maintain a bug detection rate of over 80% within the sprint a feature is developed.
